descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Jamal Mashburn scored 25 points and the Charlotte Hornets overcame a terrible shooting performance by Baron Davis to beat the Atlanta Hawks 93-86 on Saturday night.
article.headline: Hornets overcome off night from Davis
article.linkText: Hornets gain on Magic with win over Hawks
article.story:
ATLANTA (AP) -- Given the sparse the crowds in Charlotte, Jamal Mashburn doesn't think the Hornets are terribly concerned about homecourt advantage in the playoffs. "Having homecourt is not all that important," Mashburn said. "I've been on teams that won the first game on the road, and then we had the homecourt advantage. Our home court is a little fickle right now as far as the fans are concerned." Mashburn scored 25 points and the Hornets overcame a poor shooting performance by Baron Davis to beat the Atlanta Hawks 93-86 on Saturday night. Charlotte, which has won three straight and four of five, moved within a half-game of fourth-place Orlando in the Eastern Conference standings. With owners George Shinn and Ray Woolridge eager to complete the Hornets' move to New Orleans, Mashburn thinks the team often plays more relaxed on the road. There were approximately 9,000 no-shows for a home victory over Washington Friday. The game had sold out before the season started, but interest waned with Wizards guard Michael Jordan out for the season with a knee injury. "It's important for us to continue to work and continue to prepare for the playoffs," Mashburn said. "When you're playing this time of year, you're playing against teams like Atlanta with a point to prove. They played extremely hard." Davis, whose 18.5 point scoring average ranks second-best for the Hornets, scored just five points on 2-for-15 shooting. Davis had not shot that poorly since March 12, when he went 1-for-10 and scored just four points in a 107-66 road loss to the Los Angeles Lakers. The lead changed nine times, but Mashburn's 3-pointer with 7:15 left in the third quarter made it 60-57 and put the Hornets ahead to stay. "You can attribute it to their D," Hawks guard Jason Terry said. "Or you can attribute it to us not making shots. I feel that they're a great ballclub." Atlanta tied the game for the last time at 66 with 1:36 remaining in the third on two free throws by Shareef Abdur-Rahim. Abdur-Rahim, who led the Hawks with 21 points and 12 rebounds, ended the scoring for Atlanta after hitting two more fouls shots with 15.7 seconds to go. The Hornets, leading 91-86 called timeout before Mashburn ended the game with a pair of free throws. "Charlotte had a lot to do with our shots not falling," Hawks coach Lon Kruger said. "We rushed some shots early, but there's a reason for that. We just have to finish opportunities that we get and we have to not give them second opportunities." Terry scored 19 for Atlanta, and Ira Newble added his first career double-double with 16 points and 12 rebounds. P.J. Brown had 14 points and 14 rebounds for the Hornets, who have won eight of their last nine against Atlanta. Charlotte outscored the Hawks 21-6 on second-chance points. "That's the difference in the game," Hornets coach Paul Silas said. "The second-chance points in the first half were killing us. The guys just started putting bodies on people."

Game notes
Charlotte improved to 18-2 on the road when leading at the end of the third quarter. ... A jam by Abdur-Rahim from the right baseline capped a 27-11 run and gave the Hawks their first lead at 40-39. ... Atlanta starters DerMarr Johnson and Nazr Mohammed combined for only four points on 2-for-12 shooting. ... The Hornets' 95 percent on free throws (19-for-20) was a season high for a Hawks opponent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
